required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Utility of Restrata With Split Thickness Skin Graft to Reconstruct the Forearm Donor Site
clinical_study.official_title: Utility of Restrata With Split Thickness Skin Graft to Reconstruct the Forearm Donor Site

brief_summary.textblock: Understand association between use of Restrata (Acera Surgical Inc., St. Louis, MO) in forearm flap reconstruction with donor site healing and function

primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with tendon exposure

primary_outcome.measure: Surface area of split-thickness skin graft incorporation
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of surface area of split-thickness skin graft incorporation

arm_group.arm_group_label: Restrata with a split-thickness skin graft

intervention.description: Restrata is a sterile, single use device intended for use in local management of wounds
intervention.arm_group_label: Restrata with a split-thickness skin graft

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. All patients age 19 or greater that will undergo radial forearm free flap or ulnar free flap.
2. Photo documentation of wound bed at two weeks and four weeks must be obtainable either by physician or patient.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Active systemic immunosuppression (active use of high-dose steroids (≥40mg prednisone daily or equivalent) or other immunosuppressive medications OR medical conditions causing immunosuppression, i.e. human immunodeficiency virus etc).
2. Diabetes mellitus with most recent Hemoglobin A1c ≥10.0 within 30 days prior to surgery.
3. Morbid obesity (BMI >40).
4. Inability to maintain wrist immobilization for full planned period.
5. Severe malnutrition (prealbumin levels <10 mg per dL within 30 days prior to surgery OR BMI <15 (very severely underweight).
6. Other conditions felt to significantly impair wound healing per surgeon discretion.
